author: gstein
msg: Begin the revamp of the Python test system.
This commit creates a two new classes for representing the state or
operational information related to a working copy. As an example of
their use, basic_tests.py was converted.
[ all files in tests/clients/cmdline ]
* svntest/wc.py: new file
Implements the 'State' and 'StateItem' classes. These are organized
as a dictionary of path -> item objects. Some simple operations are
defined on them for now, with the primary being .old_tree() to
construct an old-style tree for comparison (until we create new
comparison code) and usage by unconverted portions of the system.
* svntest/__init__.py: import the new 'wc' module
* svntest/tree.py: remove the 'admin_dir' and 'rm' globals. the
invocation of main.get_admin_name() was causing a loop during the
importing of the test modules. these symbols were not used anyways.
* svntest/actions.py:
(run_and_verify_checkout, run_and_verify_update,
run_and_verify_switch, run_and_verify_commit,
run_and_verify_status, run_and_verify_unquiet_status):
if the tree that was passed in is a State instance, then convert
it to an old style tree.
(get_virginal_state): new-style replacement for the
get_virginal_status_list() function.
* svntest/main.py:
(greek_state): new global holding a State instance representing the
greek tree.
* basic_tests.py:
(basic_checkout, basic_status, basic_commit, basic_update,
basic_corruption, basic_merge, basic_conflict, basic_cleanup,
basic_revert, basic_switch, basic_delete): replace all calls to
get_virginal_status_list() with get_virginal_state(). replace the
loops to modify status lists with operations on the state
object. replace output lists of items with instantiations of State
and StateItem objects.
[ I believe that a number of *_path variables are now obsolete,
but I didn't bother too scrub those; I wanted to simply show
what was needed for converting from old to new style ]

author: rooneg
msg: Fix a crash when you try to svnlook into a non-existant repository.
Reported By:  Blair Zajac <blair@orcaware.com>
* subversion/svnlook/main.c
(main): initialize c.fs to NULL so we can check that it's valid before we
try to close it.

author: blair
msg: Feedback from Greg Stein on commit 2177.
* tools/hook-scripts/commit-email.pl
(read_from_process): New subroutine that calls safe_read_from_pipe
and checks for the success or failure of the command.
(main):
Replace all the calls to safe_read_from_pipe and the checks for
the success of svnlook with calling read_from_process instead.
Do not quit immediately if any of the svnlook commands fail.
Instead send in the email that the command failed and any output
from the command.
Now that the errors from the svnlook commands may be processed by
the script which do not match the regular expressions, set some
variables to '' instead of leaving them set to undef so that
Perl won't complain when they won't get set by the regex.

author: rooneg
msg: By popular demand, remove the 'svn rollback' command.  There are a number of
opinions as to what the semantics of the command should be, and even if we
could decide on the semantics, there are non-trivial issues with dealing with
mixed-revision working copies.  All the functionality is available via the
merge command anyway, so the consensus is that it is better to have the user
specifically say what they want via 'svn merge' than to have them be confused
by the behavior of 'svn rollback'.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/cl.h
remove the declaration of svn_cl__rollback.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/rollback-cmd.c
remove this file.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/main.c
(svn_cl__cmd_table): remove the 'rollback' command's entry.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/getopt_tests_data/svn_help_stdout
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/getopt_tests_data/svn_stderr
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/getopt_tests_data/svn--help_stdout
remove the rollback command from the getopt tests.

author: blair
msg: When setting up commit-email.pl today, I ran into a bunch of stupid
little things, such as not commenting out the lines REPOS=${1} and
REV=${2} in post-commit, which caused commit-email to not be passed
enough command line options.  These changes make commit-email.pl more
error resistant and check the command line options better.
* tools/hook-scripts/commit-email.pl
(safe_read_from_pipe): New subroutine that does a safe fork and exec
without using /bin/sh to run the command and return the program's
exit value and output.
(usage): New subroutine.
(main):
Update copyright date.
Add -r command line option that specifies the Reply-To email
address instead of hard wiring dev@subversion.tigris.org.  Only
set the Reply-To email header if -r is used.  I don't think the
svn mailing list wants every project's Reply-To set to this by
default :)
Use Getopt::Long to process command line options instead of
processing them by hand.  Makes it easier to check if the
minimum number of command line arguments have been supplied.
Use &safe_read_from_pipe for all calls to run svnlook.
Chdir into /tmp so that svnlook diff can create .svnlook
directory.  On my system commit-email.pl is run in / which it
cannot write to.
Perl-style: When pushing values onto array's, don't put the values
inside ()'s.
